executive_summary: The Personal Watercraft Manufacturing industry has navigated turbulent waters as the COVID-19 pandemic and its aftereffects created challenging conditions. Personal watercrafts are highly discretionary purchases, with demand flowing in line with trends in discretionary income and consumer confidence. The industry grew steadily during heady economic times prior to the outbreak of COVID-19 and boomed throughout the pandemic as consumer spending rose, interest rates dropped to record-low levels and consumers found themselves with more leisure time as a result of pandemic-era restrictions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumers Used Covid-19 Free Time to Invest in Leisure
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers use personal watercrafts almost exclusively for leisure activities. As a result, their use depends heavily on consumer leisure time. The pandemic increased interest in outdoor activities, including water-based recreation. The sea and other bodies of water largely remained free to use while most leisure activities shut down. As a result, many Americans took to the outdoors during the peak of the pandemic, driving sales for personal watercraft.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Have Driven Down Exports
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A sharp rise in inflation has hindered personal watercrafts sales. As a nonessential purchase, sales have dipped consumers opt to save money where they can. More directly, efforts to combat inflation have also decreased export sales. While rising interest rates have slowed inflation, they have simultaneously strengthened the US dollar. As a result, American-made products have become more expensive abroad.

Although international trade flows of personal watercrafts have declined in line with efforts to combat high inflation, the industry has continued to globalize. The top two destinations for industry exports are Canada and Mexico, owing to the close proximity of these countries to the United States and reduced trade barriers under the North American Free Trade Agreement. Moreover, the industry's largest players remain well-recognized foreign brands.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Personal watercraft manufacturers will benefit from economic growth, as consumer spending and disposable income increased will produce more purchases. A rise in consumer confidence, even as interest rates remain high, will increase consumers' capacity to spend on discretionary items, like personal watercrafts. Perhaps even more worrying to manufacturers is the projected stagnation in leisure time as the economy continues to expand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INTEREST RATES WILL CONTINUE TO BE A PAIN POINT FOR MANUFACTURERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve is anticipated to keep interest rates high in an effort to curb inflation. Even as early indicators have shown that inflation is beginning to temper, interest rates will remain heightened at least through at least in the next few years. Because personal watercraft are costly discretionary purchases, higher interest rates will discourage consumers from making purchases on durable goods.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INTERNATIONAL TRADE WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Following challenges stemming from pandemic and sharp interest hikes, international trade trends will normalize in this new environment. The US dollar is actually forecast to depreciate in the short term, driving export growth for domestic manufacturers. The continuation of reduced trade barriers across North America will also encourage a rise in imports, as is manufacturers' movement of plants to countries with lower costs.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures personal recreational watercraft that riders can sit or stand on.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - steady

key_trends: Time Spent on Leisure and Sports

market_segmentation.segment_description: A majority of this segment's consumers typically own a boat, are employed and have a steady stream of disposable income. Therefore, this group is most likely to spend money on recreational products, like personal watercraft.

Since consumers in this group have generally accumulated sufficient disposable income, they are able to spend both on inexpensive items and on more costly varieties. Purchases from this segment fluctuate more substantially than those of older consumers during changes in economic conditions.

Much like their cohorts in the 31 to 49 age group, these individuals typically experience a steady income. Many have amassed moderate personal wealth at this time in their life, which promotes the purchases of recreational vehicles, like personal watercrafts. Many in this age group are new retirees, who have ample free time and are still physically fit enough to safely use the industry's products.

Exports have grown to account for more than 15.0% of total industry revenue. The export of personal watercraft is affected by the value of the US dollar, as American-made goods are typically more expensive because of the high cost of labor and the strength of the currency

Though people in this age group have a substantial amount of free time when compared with those in other market segments, many rely solely on savings and government transfers to cover living expenses. Such a budget leaves little discretionary income for purchasing personal watercrafts. The physical demands of operating personal watercraft are also typically too taxing for those in this age group.

products_and_services.product_description: This product can hold up to three persons and is usually for day use. Sit-down personal watercraft products are powered by motor and are used for recreational boating, fishing and water-skiing.
This type of watercraft suggests that the rider stands or kneels in a tray with a handlepole that pivots upward and downward. Some stand-up watercraft models include a cutoff switch.

Rescue watercraft (RWC) are for the purposes of occupational use. In some circles, the vessel description has been changed to 'Rescue Water Craft' or RWC to separate the name from an operational recreational mindset to professional conduct.

tier_2_suppliers: Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
Engine & Turbine Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Aircraft, Marine & Railroad Transportation Equipment Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for personal watercraft is heavily influenced by trends in disposable income levels, as these products are considered luxury recreational goods.
When consumer confidence is high, individuals are more likely to make discretionary purchases like personal watercraft.
Higher interest rates increase the cost of financing for big-ticket items like personal watercraft, dampening demand.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Historically, personal watercraft manufacturers have dealt with pressure from foreign producers importing to US markets. Recently due to an appreciating US dollar, import penetration has increased.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports Fall as US Companies Battle Appreciation of US Dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: Stemming from the fallout of COVID-19, US companies had to fight supply chain issues as well as a rapidly appreciating US dollar through 2023. Because of these problems, exports tumbled in 2020 and contracted sizably in 2022 as interest rates rose, strengthening the position of the US dollar.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) Drives Exports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Canada is the largest market for personal watercraft exports. The USMCA cuts trade barriers between the two nations, making it easier for domestic manufacturers to sell golf carts in Canada.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region accounts for the second largest share of personal watercraft manufacturing activity. The region is a long-time home to manufacturing industry and has large bodies of water that allow for personal watercraft use.

The Southeast accounts for the largest concentration of personal watercraft manufacturing activity. The Southeast region is a manufacturing hub within the United States, with easy access to road, rail and maritime distribution and supply channels. Florida surpasses all other states in the region with its large coastline and warm weather, which enable year-round water activities.

The West's massive population combined with its diverse geographical scene makes this a perfect market for players to hone in on. California is an activity center due to its coast on the Pacific Ocean. The state also boasts the largest population of any state in the country.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The CPSC has full federal oversight over most products produced within the US. When a personal watercraft is manufactured, developers must convey if the product is intended for adults, for general use by consumers of all ages, or if the product is not intended primarily for children. Since personal watercrafts are sold for general use by consumers aged 18 and older, they are typically not children's products.

Watercrafts are subject to regulation by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the California Air Resources Board (CARB). Emissions have been rapidly declining in recent years, due largely to the EPA standards that became effective in early 1999 and CARB standards that became effective with the 2001 model year.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Revenue volatility is high for personal watercraft manufacturers.
The industry is capital intensive for personal watercraft manufacturers.
There is low and steady industry assistance for personal watercraft manufacturers.
There is high and steady globalization in the personal watercraft manufacturing industry.

factors_decreased_barrier: Low market concentration in the personal watercraft manufacturing industry decreases barriers to entry.

basis_points.basis_description: Economies of scale dominate personal watercraft manufacturers. Companies that can produce and move product in bulk are able to outcompete smaller manufacturers.

Manufacturers incorporate attractive features on their products through heavy investment in research and development. This allows companies to patent their technology, enabling them to command higher prices.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Yamaha, the largest manufacturer, expected to accounts for nearly half of total industry revenue. Market share has increased slightly as larger industry companies have expanded their presence domestically in light of favorable macroeconomic conditions.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Small Manufacturers Maintain a Sizable Presence
concentration_points.concentration_description: Meanwhile, smaller personal watercraft manufacturers operate locally and provide services to a small segment of the population. Business locations are also concentrated in coastal areas, allowing larger manufacturers to acquire smaller competitors and leading to increased consolidation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the Largest Cost Component
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are expected to account for 60.1% of revenue in 2023. Personal watercraft manufacturers require a variety of raw materials, like steel, raw steel, fiberglass, plastic and paints, in addition to components like watercraft engines and accessories.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit Varies According to Company Scale
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit is expected to account for 6.2% of revenue in 2023. Profitability is highly variable depending on a company's core product and the scale of operations. Larger manufacturers are better able to achieve higher profit margins in any given year because they are able to command a greater market presence and attribute higher prices to brand name and reputation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES TOO VARY ACCORDING TO PRODUCTION SCALE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs are forecast to account for 1.9% of revenue in 2023. Labor costs for mass production of personal watercraft are lower than niche manufacturers that require more experienced workers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Personal watercraft manufacturers hire skilled labor for design, innovation and quality control.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Personal watercraft manufacturers hire skilled labor for design, innovation and quality control. Automation has reduced the need for blue-collar positions.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue Growth is Tied to Consumer Confidence
volatility_points.volatility_description: As a highly discretionary purchase, personal watercraft are strongly linked to consumers' overall willingness to spend. Therefore, demand for boating products is often influenced by periods of economic uncertainty, and vice versa, periods of strong growth.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Oil Prices Influence Cost of Personal Watercraft
volatility_points.volatility_description: The price of oil drives the cost of fueling personal watercraft. The world price of crude oil can be highly volatile, and seesawed during the COVID-19 pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This product can hold up to three persons and is usually for day use. Sit-down personal watercraft products are powered by motor and are used for recreational boating, fishing and water-skiing.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: STAND-UP PERSONAL WATERCRAFT ACCOUNT FOR MORE THAN A THIRD OF ALL REVENUE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This type of watercraft suggests that the rider stands or kneels in a tray with a handlepole that pivots upward and downward. Some stand-up watercraft models include a cutoff switch.

Rescue watercraft (RWC) are for the purposes of occupational use. In some circles, the vessel description has been changed to 'Rescue Water Craft' or RWC to separate the name from an operational recreational mindset to professional conduct.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Sport Personal Watercraft Accounts for a Minor Share
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Sport personal watercraft can hold one to two persons on board. Although this sport personal watercraft products are no longer sold within the United States, they are manufactured and exported domestically.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Domestic manufacturers must compete with significant import penetration, as the appreciation of the US dollar over the past five years has made industry imports comparatively less expensive for domestic customers.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Trends in employment and discretionary incomes directly influence the financial performance of the industry, which is strongest when customers have high disposable incomes and confidence in the macroeconomy.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Oil prices play a major role in demand for industry goods; when the price of oil rises, the operating cost of personal watercrafts also increases, constricting demand for industry products.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near important suppliers?
FAQs.answer: The location of customers and suppliers can affect the cost of inputs through the price of transportation; proximity of industry manufacturers to customers lowers the costs associated with transportation and communication.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new fuel-efficient technology?
FAQs.answer: New fuel-efficient technology is being developed to create economies of scale for the industry; these new developments are used to attract buyers that seek more economical products.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to safeguard your company's proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Most industry companies protect investment in research and development and inventions with patent protections, which contribute to companies' ability to provide leading products and to generate revenue from licensing.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators must abide by general government manufacturing codes and regulations; these include health and safety regulations set by the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators receive assistance from the Personal Watercraft Industry Association (PCIA) and the National Marine Manufacturers Association (NMMA).

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profitability is highly variable depending on a company's scale of operations; larger manufacturers often achieve higher profit margins because they are able to command a greater market presence and attribute higher prices to brand name and reputation.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Seasonality is a major determinant of advertising costs for industry manufacturers, as personal watercraft producers are more likely to advertise in the summer months.

FAQs.question: How does your company protect its intellectual property?
FAQs.answer: It is a firm's general practice to protect investment in research and development and inventions with patent protection.

FAQs.question: What methods do you use to achieve low-cost production?
FAQs.answer: The ability to achieve low-cost production through economies of scale and scope is an advantage because the industry has many standardized products.

FAQs.question: How much time is invested in research and development? What are the costs associated with this?
FAQs.answer: Companies devote significant resources to research and development to stay competitive.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuations in the world price of crude oil affect your company?
FAQs.answer: Consumers are less likely to buy and use personal watercraft when the price of oil is high, as it raises the effective operating costs for watercraft.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the trade-weighted index? How have fluctuations in the value of the US dollar affected demand for your products?
FAQs.answer: Exchange rates play a significant part in the industry's ability to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: How do you stimulate demand when disposable income levels are low?
FAQs.answer: Disposable income significantly influences the purchases of new personal watercraft.
